= Introduction =

This page documents how to build OMD 

Opensource Multibody Dynamics (OMD) is written in C++ and uses cmake so you can use your favorite IDE.

= Details =
  # Use SVN to check out the code. <br /> If you use Windows, you will probably want this: <br /> http://tortoisesvn.net/downloads.html <br /> The command to check out the code base:{{{ svn checkout https://omd.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ omd }}}<br />
  # Get Eigen.  <br />  http://eigen.tuxfamily.org <br />  OMD uses the Eigen math library.  To build, OMD has to be able to find Eigen.<br />
  #  Get CMake <br /> http://eigen.tuxfamily.org/ <br />
  #  Get Bullet Collision and Math Library (Optional)
http://code.google.com/p/bullet/downloads/list

OMD uses the collision library from bullet.
You may be interested in Bullet instead of OMD.  Bullet is geared towards video games and the like.

5.  Get swig (Optional)
http://www.swig.org/
swig is used to make OMD available within python
